page.title: 10Ardross: amenities
page.content:
(3) Loch Dubh
Loch Dubh is gaelic for 'black loch'. There are four islands on the loch with seagulls nesting. There are trees and bushes on the islands and fish live in the loch. The loch is wooded on three sides and grassed on the remaining side. The Forestry Commission own the land around the loch and there is a log cabin in the woods. Up until a couple of years ago the people of Ardross used the loch for swimming and fishing but this has stopped as people from out of the area were misusing the amenity and polluting the loch. The loch is about 400 metres wide and 800 metres in length: it is about 15 metres deep. It is in a beautiful setting north-west of the Mains.
